sub_title: ExCulture Co-founder | Biotech Startup | MSc Chemistry
summary:
My interest in science, sustainability, and the environment began while growing up on a farm in Ireland, and has continued to evolve through my subsequent academic, professional, voluntary, and personal endeavors. 

I'm curious about:
•sustainable business development
•biotechnology
•human health & nutrition
•future-proof supply chains
•policy-making
•education

In my free time, you'll likely find me engaged in one of the following activities: 
Yoga🧘‍♀️|CrossFit🏋‍♀️|Rowing🚣‍♀️|Reading📚|Gardening 🌱🌻

projects.title: Analysis of Pear Ester Flavoring Samples using Broadband Rotational Spectroscopy
projects.description:
Physical Chemistry lab project with Professor Brooks Pate and fellow students using broadband rotational spectroscopy to analyze pear ester samples.
This project was presented by Ph.D. candidate Channing West at the 2018 International Symposium on Molecular Spectroscopy in Chicago.

contributors.headline: ExCulture Co-founder | Biotech Startup | MSc Chemistry

publications.name: Styrene Production from Benzene and Ethylene Catalyzed by Palladium (II): Enhancement of Selectivity toward Styrene via Temperature-dependent Vinyl Ester Consumption

authors.headline: ExCulture Co-founder | Biotech Startup | MSc Chemistry

profile_positions.description: At ExCulture, we're working on developing our novel patented bioprocess technology that has the capacity to produce a range of biomedical compounds of interest through the fermentation of readily available, cost-effective carbon sources.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Writing articles for local newspapers: Dungarvan Observer and Dungarvan Leader to keep members and community up to date with the activities and achievements of the rowing club.

Implement Canva, the online graphic design programme, to create posters advertising summer camps, training programmes and adult 'learn-to-row' courses.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Officer (Volunteer)

profile_positions.description:
Fresh Ventures Studio is a venture-building program and startup studio based in The Netherlands. Co-founding companies to address systemic challenges in the food system. Focused on regenerative agriculture and aquaculture. 
My role was to support the Program Lead in the delivery and operations of the program.
profile_positions.title: Program Assistant Intern

profile_positions.description:
Analyzed the landscape of female-empowering initiatives in the Netherlands to support the development of a mission statement for Female Ventures. Created a final presentation summary deck which was presented to board members of Female Ventures.

"Female Ventures is a non-profit organization that stimulates and supports ambition, leadership, and entrepreneurship for women in corporates, SMEs, and start-ups. Women supporting women who want to grow and take the next step in their career."
profile_positions.title: Brand Analyst Intern (Volunteer)

profile_positions.description:
6-month internship to fulfill the Business Development requirement of my management specialization in the Science-Based Business track of my master. Final internship grade: 8,5

Gained functional knowledge of the operations of a Project Management Office in a multinational organization. 

Supported the Transition Lead of the AkzoNobel Fast Forward Finance initiative. 
The motivation behind the Fast Forward Finance initiative is to improve financial operations across the organization including through the standardisation of processes on a global level and the implementation of digital technologies to improve end-to-end process management.

Co-developed a Project Management career progression pathway, motivated by the need to develop a framework of key skills and competencies associated with project management roles in order to help employees discover and shape their careers in the project management space.
profile_positions.title: GBS Project Management Intern

profile_positions.description:
The Leiden University Student Platform (LUS) is a think-tank composed of student members representing each Faculty of the University and an independent Chair who present ideas to the Executive Board.
My role was to discuss topics related to education and student affairs that affect all students through collaborative meetings with the other members and with students from the Faculty of Science as well as collaborating with the Study Associations, the Student Assessor, and members of the Faculty Council.
The LUS is also responsible for awarding the annual Leiden Teaching Prize.
profile_positions.title: LUS member of the Faculty of Science

profile_positions.description:
I was a resident assistant (RA) at one of the International Student Residences for the 2020/21 academic year. 
Collaborated with my fellow RA's to support students in practical and personal matters as they settled into their student life in Leiden.
profile_positions.title: Resident Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Project title: "NO reduction by CO on an Rh(100) catalyst."
Grade: 8.5
I joined the Catalysis and Surface Chemistry group at Leiden University in February 2020 where I carried out my MSc Thesis project concerning NO reduction via CO on a rhodium catalyst using Scanning Tunnelling Microscopy (STM) to probe the surface of an Rh(100) single crystal in an attempt to elucidate the morphological and topographical changes that occur to the metal's surface under realistic reaction conditions. 
My project was carried out under the guidance of Dr. Irene Groot and Ph.D. candidate Dajo Boden.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern: Operando Research in Heterogeneous Catalysis

profile_positions.description:
I was a student member of the MSc Chemistry Programme Committee for the 2019/20 year.
The purpose of the MSc Chemistry Programme Committee is for students and educators to come together to oversee the quality of teaching across the MSc courses. 
Engaged in monthly meetings pertaining to the evaluation of courses, complaints and assessment of various aspects of the education and examination regulations. 
Attended the Leiden University Annual Programme Committee Conference on February 5th, 2020. Contributed to the discussion on what conditions are necessary for a well-functioning programme committee.
profile_positions.title: Programme Committee (MSc Chemistry) Student Member

profile_positions.description:
Meeting and greeting customers, taking orders, anticipating needs, and offering guidance on menu items. 
Communicating with kitchen staff and collaborating with other team members for high-quality service.
Operating coffee machines to produce a variety of beverages.
Competent processing of charges, production of bills, and collection of payments.
Closing of the restaurant area, setting up and cleaning equipment, and restocking items.
profile_positions.title: Waitress

profile_positions.description:
Project title: "Porous Nanoparticle - Protein Interactions" 
Grade: 3.8/4.2
For my Bachelor Thesis, I investigated the formation of a protein corona on nanoporous  Zeolite-Y particles in the Centre for Bionano Interactions, UCD. This work was important to the development of a foundational understanding of how such porous materials will interact with biological systems in applications such as drug delivery.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern: Centre for Bionano Interactions

profile_positions.description:
Performed development work to support operations regarding vessel cleaning.
Exercised good lab practice and implemented ELN (electronic lab notebook) for GMP documentation.  
Used Empower for HPLC analysis and interpretation.
Involved with safety and quality culture through lab audits.
Participated in a project team working on a technology transfer.
profile_positions.title: Process Development and Commercialisation Internship: Student Chemist

volunteer_experiences.description: Mentored a 3rd year BSc Science student.

Completed Rowing Ireland Introductory Coaching Course in June 2016 and obtained Garda vetting for instructing junior/new members of the rowing club.

Summer 2019: we held our first rowing summer camp and I assisted the senior coaches including coxing and rowing in the bow of the quadruple skull and training individuals in the double skull.
Assisted with the new adult 'learn-to-row' programme in August 2019.

Take part in numerous fundraising events such as the Annual Sponsored Row, the Cappoquin regatta and bucket collections.

Rowed competitively both individually and in crews winning numerous first place medals in regional and national regattas.
